page.title: 18History of Acklington (1)
page.content: {1177}Eclinton first mentioned on maps and documents. Other early spelling - Akleton, Acleytun. {1248}21 tenants paying rent to the Norman Lord of Warkworth. {1316}Robert Bruce & Scots wasted Northumberland. Famine ensued. Nine holdings lay uncultivated. {1349}Great Plague killed over third of population and hindered progress. {1460}Acklington has unenviable reputation for witchcraft. {1595}11 men sent to the muster of armed men at Abberwick-edge. {1616}18 tenant farmers & 5 cottagers paying rent to Lord of Warkworth. {1715}Colliery existed. {1775}Tin & Iron Foundry opened. {1791}Woollen Mill opened on foundry site (closed in 1884). {1853}The present village school was opened.
